doc.title: Cement industry
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Cement industry Raise POs still bearish on two firms tardy price hikes albeit varying weak overseasCement industry Raise_2025-08-29

passages.text: Price Objective Change

Despite the positive impact of more- than- expected domestic price hikes, we trim our earnings estimates to reflect higher costs and weak volumes in overseas cement business. We base our price objective (PO) on FY3/27 P/E of 7x (was 6x) taking given the rise in overall industry valuations. We revise our operating profit (OP) estimates for FY3/26 from 85.9bn to 81.6bn (consensus: 83.9bn), for FY3/27 from 92.1bn to 89.6bn (94.1bn), and for FY3/28 from 95.4bn to 93.3bn (95.4bn). We reiterate Underperform as we expect weaker earnings than consensus, mainly due to a continued decline in domestic cement volume and slowing overseas cement business growth.

We revise down our earnings estimates, mainly due to delayed cement price hikes and cost growth associated with facility problems. We base our PO on FY3/27 P/E of 7.5x (was 7.0x), taking into account the rise in overall industry valuations. We revise our OP estimates for FY3/26 from 19.0bn to 17.8bn (consensus: 19.6bn), for FY3/27 from 21.6bn to 21.0bn (23.3bn), and for FY3/28 from 22.6bn to 21.8bn (24.9bn). We reiterate Underperform as we expect weaker earnings than consensus, mainly owing to delayed price hikes and a continued volume decline in domestic cement business.

A gap has emerged between the two companies in terms of the 2,000/metric ton (mt) price hike originally planned from April. We estimate that mainly Kanto- based Taiheiyo Cement has achieved around \(60\%\) of this (average unit price: 17,200/mt, according to BofAe) against around \(10\%\) - plus for mainly Kansai- based Sumitomo Osaka Cement (BofAe: 16,300/mt).

We have revised cement price forecasts for 2Q onwards for Taiheiyo Cement to +200 from July (17,400/mt), +400 from October (17,800/mt), and +200 from April 2026 (18,000/mt), and for Sumitomo Osaka Cement to +300 from July (16,600/mt), +1,200 from October (17,800/mt) and +200 from April 2026 (18,000/mt). We thus expect the same price for both from 2H, but with Sumitomo Osaka Cement lagging behind in 2Q, as in 1Q.

We calculate our \(\) 3,400\(PO from our FY3/27 EPS forecast and a\) 7.5x P/E. The 7.5x P/E is around a 30% discount to the trailing five - year average, reflecting the worsening outlook for domestic cement, the company's largest business. Potential upside catalysts for the share price are (1) domestic cement demand recovery, (2) further cement price hike announcements, (3) substantial enhancements to shareholder returns, (4) sharply lower coal market prices, (5) progress in industry consolidation, and (6) rapid yen appreciation. Downside risks are (1) even further weakness in domestic cement demand, (2) failure to hike prices, (3) deterioration in shareholder returns, (4) rapidly rising coal market prices, (5) stalled industry reorganization, and (6) sharp yen depreciation.

We calculate our \(\) 3,400\(PO from our FY3/27 EPS forecast and a\) 7x P/E. The \(7x P/E\) is in line with the trailing five - year average multiple. Potential upside catalysts for the share price are (1) domestic cement demand recovery, (2) further cement price hike announcements, (3) substantial enhancements to shareholder returns, (4) sharply lower coal market prices, (5) progress in industry consolidation, and (6) rapid yen depreciation. Downside risks are (1) even further weakness in domestic cement demand, (2) failure to hike prices, (3) deterioration in shareholder returns, (4) rapidly rising coal market prices, (5) stalled industry reorganization, and (6) sharp yen appreciation.

Qmethod is the set of BofA Global Research standard measures that serve to maintain global consistency under three broad headings: Business Performance, Quality of Earnings, and valuations. The key features of Qmethod are: A consistently structured, detailed, and transparent methodology. Guidelines to maximize the effectiveness of the comparative valuation process, and to identify some common pitfalls. Qtabose is our real-time global research database that is sourced directly from our equity analysts earnings models and includes forecasted as well as historical data for income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements for companies covered by BofA Global Research.
